result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (3rd) and Operating w/ PAC (3rd). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (3rd) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (3rd) was dismissed by the court.

  • Jonathan Crane Blackdeer was found guilty of OWI (3rd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jonathan Crane Blackdeer in court with attorney Scott S. Schlough.  Defendant Jonathan Crane Blackdeer in custody.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Also has 14 CF 1 and 13 TR 1723.  9:40 AM Judge Needham calls cases and recites appearances.  Final Pretrial 14 CF 1 / 13 TR 1723 Scheduling Conference and Prelim for 15 CF 114.  State addressed the court plea agreement - 15 CF 114 prelim will be waived nc to count 2 - counts 1 and 3 DRI - $2452.00 fine - 80 days county jail credit for 80 days time served (114) - 27 mo revocation of DL - AODA and complete Driver Safety plan and VIP - 14 CF 1 / NC to count 1 - counts 2 and 3 DRI and 13 TR 1723 to be DRI - 6 yrs prison 3 yrs in and 3 yrs ES - stayed probation 3 years - AODA and follow thru - $654.00 fine - if violates probations to be consecutive 05 CF 163 Sawyer County case that is being revoked on. State Count 1 repeater to be deleted  14 CF 1.  Atty Schlough agrees with recitation.  Court addressed the defendant.  Defendant is sworn in by Deputy Clerk - questioned by the court re: plea questionnaire.  Court advised the defendant has to his rights and can not possess a firearm and can not be elected to a public office and can not vote until he is off probation/out of prison.  Atty's Stipulate to facts of record.
 Defendant entered pleas of 15 CF 114 - count 2 - NC and NC to 14 CF 1 as amended.  Court finds defendant guilty count 2 in 15 CF 114 and Count 1 in 14 CF 1 w/o the enhancer - All other counts are dismissed and used as read-ins.  13 TR 1723 is dismissed.
Atty's waive prelim.  State argues sentencing and addressed 05 CF 163.   Victim Statement tendered to the Court by the State.  Atty Schlough argues sentencing.  Court questions attorney's as to challenge and earned release.  Atty Schlought does not believe he is disqualified for those programs.  State makes stmt.  Court addressed the defendant.

COURT:  15 CF 114 count 2 - Fine $2452.00 - 80 days county jail with credit for 114 days time served - 27 month revocation of driver's license with IID - AODA and complete the driver safety plan with victim impact panel (.171) - 


14 CF 1 Count 1 - 6 years prison/3 yrs incarcerated and 3 years on Extended Supervision imposed/stayed - 3 years probation / AODA and follow thru - fine of $654.00 - if defendant violates probation prison term is to be consecutive to 05 CF 153 Sawyer County Case - DNA sample and surcharge if not paid - random testing - not to enter establishment that sells alcohol for consumption on the premises unless restraunt that sells alcohol - no credit against this sentence - eligible for challenge and substance abuse - 

bail is revoked remanded to prison for 05 CF 163

Defendant Jonathan C. Blackdeer in court, in custody, with attorney Scott S. Schlough.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 3, 2015 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Jonathan Crane Blackdeer in court with attorney Scott S. Schlough.  Defendant Jonathan Crane Blackdeer in custody.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant advised of rights/penalties, acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading of complaint.   DEF waives time limits for preliminary hearing.  Court enters NG plea.  Close to resolving. Defendant Jonathon Crane Blackdeer in court in custody by video.  John Yackel for the State.  Defendant wants be in person, changed mind, satisfied w/video.  PC found.   CBS $500.00   SPECIAL BOND Conditions with Random Testing
1. Defendant shall not consume any intoxicating beverages.
2. Defendant shall not enter the premises of any business that sells or serves alcoholic beverages by the drink.
EXCEPT that defendant may be on the premises of: 
for the purpose of employment, but only for the purpose of employment and only during his/her hours of employment.
3. Defendant shall be subject to RANDOM TESTING if his/her blood, breath or urine, and shall report to the Sawyer County Human Services Department at 10610 Main Street, Hayward, WI (ph. 715-638-3317) within 48 hours upon release from custody (not counting weekends and holidays) to schedule an intake session with the Sawyer County Traffic Offender Program (STOP) and to establish the procedures for the random testing. FAILURE TO REPORT TO STOP PROGRAM MAY RESULT IN THE ISSUANCE OF A WARRANT FOR THE DEFENDANT'S ARREST, MODIFICATION OF BAIL, POSSIBLE BAIL JUMPING CHARGES, AND/OR FORFEITURE OF BAIL.
